basics.name: Sarthak Pati
basics.label: Software Architect specializing in Healthcare AI solutions
basics.summary: Software Architect specializing in designing robust and deployable solutions that leverage machine learning and artificial intelligence in healthcare.

courses: IN2210 - Tracking and Detection in Computer Vision
IN2106 - Machine Learning in Medical Imaging

work.name: Indiana University
work.summary: Designed and developed software infrastructure to advance Federated Learning R&D at the Department of Pathology & Laboratory Medicine, IU School of Medicine. Led compliance with data integrity, privacy, and security standards while defining best practices for software development. Coordinated academic collaborations and industrial partnerships, contributed to grant proposals, and facilitated knowledge sharing through seminars, courses, and conference presentations.

work.name: University of Pennsylvania
work.summary: Spearheaded the development and architecture of the Federated Tumor Segmentation (FeTS) Initiative, facilitating the largest international federation of healthcare institutions. Designed and implemented the Generalized Nuanced Deep Learning Framework (GaNDLF) to advance segmentation, regression, and classification using deep learning. Bridged cutting-edge medical imaging research with the open-source scientific community and conducted seminar series on Python/C++ for medical image analysis and machine learning using tools like PyTorch, ITK, and OpenCV.

work.name: University of Pennsylvania
work.summary: Led software development at the Center for Biomedical Image Computing and Analytics, driving initiatives like the Federated Tumor Segmentation (FeTS) to support global healthcare collaborations. Spearheaded the development of tools such as the Generalized Nuanced Deep Learning Framework (GaNDLF) for segmentation, regression, and classification, and the Cancer Imaging Phenomics Toolkit (CaPTk) for advanced imaging analytics and predictive modeling. Enabled the transition of medical imaging research into the open-source community and conducted seminars on medical image analysis and machine learning using C++ and tools like ITK and OpenCV.

work.name: Technical University of Munich
work.summary: [MS Thesis] Tracking flexible needles in Ultrasound-assisted Robotic surgery using particle filters and real-time tracking and mosaicking of surgical tools and the retina in Ophthalmoscopy datasets.

work.name: microDimensions
work.summary: Extending the software framework by adding support for more file types and improving the segmentation and registration framework.

work.name: Technical University of Munich
work.summary: Real-time camera pose estimation for a single camera single marker system.

work.name: Advanced Realtime Tracking GmbH
work.summary: Detection of non-spherical markers for industrial tracking.

work.name: Indian Institute of Technology, Delhi
work.summary: [BE Thesis] Real Time Locomotion Classification based on surface EMG signals from thigh muscles for use in an above-knee prosthetic device.

work.name: Defence Research and Development Organisation (DRDO)
work.summary: Quality assessment in modern MRI systems and analyze methods to improve image acquisition and processing for a new neck coil design

awards.title: Certification in Supervisory Skills
awards.summary: The Supervisory Skills Certificate program provides an introduction to the skills and information necessary to being an effective supervisor within the Perelman School of Medicine (SOM).  Instructors for the program represent a variety of offices across the SOM and University, including the Office of General Counsel, the Office of International Programs, the Office of Affirmative Action and Equal Opportunity Programs, Perelman SOM Human Resources,  and the Office of Organization Effectiveness.

awards.title: Automatic Non-rigid Histological Image Registration Winner
awards.awarder: IEEE International Symposium on Biomedical Imaging
awards.summary: Automatic Non-rigid Histological Image Registration (ANHIR) challenge aims at the automatic nonlinear image registration of 2D microscopy images of histopathology tissue samples stained with different dyes. The task is difficult due to non-linear deformations affecting the tissue samples, different appearance of each stain, repetitive texture, and the large size of the whole slide images. Our team was placed 2nd overall among all competitors and were invited to present our method at the workshop.

awards.title: Winner of the Brain Tumor Segmentation Challenge
awards.summary: Lead the development of the software packages used by the team that won the BRATS (http://braintumorsegmentation.org/) challenge in 2015.

awards.title: Category Head, Design
awards.summary: Category Head at Revels 2008, the cultural festival of Manipal Institute of Technology (Manipal University).

awards.summary: Lead the Design Team at Techtatva 2007, the technical festival of Manipal University.
